Detailed Description

A sequence generator is used to obtain unique values.

Typedef Documentation

◆ db_seqvalue_t

typedef db_largeint_t db_seqvalue_t

Sequence value data type.

See also
db_next_sequence

Function Documentation

◆ db_seqdef_init()

db_result_t db_seqdef_init ( db_seqdef_t *  def)

Initialize sequence schema definition.

Parameters
defSequence definition to initialize.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.
  • DB_FAIL on failure.

On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

  • DB_EINVAL Sequence definition is null.
See also
db_create_sequence, db_seqdef_destroy, db_drop_sequence,
get_db_error, clear_db_error, Error Handling

◆ db_seqdef_destroy()

db_result_t db_seqdef_destroy ( db_seqdef_t *  def)

Destroy sequence schema definition.

Parameters
defSequence schema definition to destroy.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.
  • DB_FAIL on failure.

On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

  • DB_EINVAL Sequence definition parameter is null.
See also
db_create_sequence, db_seqdef_init, db_drop_sequence,
get_db_error, clear_db_error, Error Handling

◆ db_create_sequence()

db_result_t db_create_sequence ( db_t  hdb,
const db_objname_t *  name,
const db_seqdef_t *  param 
)

Create a sequence in a database using a sequence schema definition.

Parameters
hdbDatabase handle.
nameSequence name. A name must start with a letter and can be followed by one or more letters, numbers, or underscores.
paramSequence configuration.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.
  • DB_FAIL on failure.

On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

  • DB_EDUPLICATE A sequence with the same name already exists.
  • DB_EINVAL Caused by: invalid database handle, name is null, sequence configuration is invalid.
  • DB_ENAME Invalid sequence name.
  • DB_ETXSTATE A write transaction is active. The transaction must be committed or rolled back before altering the schema.
Invariant
No transaction is active on hdb.
See also
db_seqdef_init, db_seqdef_destroy, db_drop_sequence,
get_db_error, clear_db_error, Error Handling

◆ db_drop_sequence()

db_result_t db_drop_sequence ( db_t  hdb,
const db_objname_t *  name 
)

Drop a sequence from a database.

Parameters
hdbDatabase handle.
nameSequence name.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.
  • DB_FAIL on failure.

On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

  • DB_EINVAL Caused by: invalid database handle, name is null, sequence configuration is invalid.
  • DB_ESEQ Sequence does not exist.
  • DB_ETXSTATE A write transaction is active. The transaction must be committed or rolled back before altering the schema.
Invariant
No transaction is active on hdb.
See also
db_create_sequence, db_seqdef_init, db_seqdef_destroy,
get_db_error, clear_db_error, Error Handling

◆ db_describe_sequence()

db_result_t db_describe_sequence ( db_t  hdb,
const db_objname_t *  name,
db_seqdef_t *  param 
)

Obtain the schema definition for a sequence in a database.

Parameters
hdbDatabase handle.
nameSequence name.
paramRecieves the schema definition for the named sequence.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.
  • DB_FAIL on failure.

On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

  • DB_EINVAL Caused by: invalid database handle, sequence name is null, sequence definition param is null, invalid bind
  • DB_ERANGE Caused by: bind field number < 0.
See also
db_create_sequence, db_seqdef_init, db_drop_sequence, db_seqdef_destroy,
get_db_error, clear_db_error, Error Handling
